F. Don wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> ����I am reading code of JUnit, but I don't understand somewhere. Can 
> anyone help me? Thanks a lot.
> 
>     1, why to design the interface Protectable? To process the Errors 
> and Exceptions? But why not call runBare() directly in a try block(in 
> the method run() of TestResult)?

Look at junit.extensions.TestSetup, which also uses Protectable. The
interface simply makes it possible to avoid duplicating code.

>     2, what is the use of the interface TestRunListener? I can only find 
> the constants in it called, but the methods implemented in 
> BaseTestRunner is abstract and have no code, they are just left to be 
> extended?

Look at the three test runners for details.

>     3, the constuctor of TestSuite, TestSuit(Class), can only use 
> TestCase class (or its subclass) as parameter, then what if I want to 
> use other extended class?

...such as what? How can you create a TestSuite of something else? Why
would you?
